caseTitle: VOL. XVI RGL 252 VERSUS BOOK REVIEW
summary: The document is an index of articles and legal commentaries from the Review of Ghana Law (1987–88), covering diverse topics including foreign currency obligations, bail in murder cases, customary arbitration, the Companies Code, international legal issues involving South Africa, tax law implications from the Kubi case, and procedural aspects of evidence and execution. It also includes book reviews on criminal law, succession, and equity, as well as miscellany such as speeches by Justice J.N.K. Taylor and updates on the Ghana Bar Association. No actual court decision or case verdict is presented.
verdict: Not applicable – this is not a court judgment but a legal index and commentary.
rationaleHighlights: Discussion on legal principles rather than adjudicated outcomes
Analysis of international legal precedents for regional application
Procedural insights on bail, evidence, and execution in Ghana
Review of statutory and customary legal frameworks
Commentary on judicial appointments and professional recognition
confidenceNotes: The document appears to be a table of contents or index from a legal publication (Review of Ghana Law 1987–88), not a full court decision. Therefore, case details, verdicts, and judicial reasoning are not present.
